content.description: Follow good holds up and slightly right for solid, fun climbing. Finish is on the mossy ledge but a top out is possible.
content.location: From parking lot on Hopewell Woods Road take the path left maybe 100 yds until you find a side trail that goes next to a river off to the right. Follow side trail until the junction, 100yds, and turn left to arrive at rock face on left of trail. Problem is on the middle right side.

content.description: Easy problem up the right edge of the Bee's Boulder next to Bee Hive Yourself. Start at the low jug around the right arete and work up good holds to the top.
content.location: Short 1min hike up trail to the right from Hopewell Woods Rd trail head. Boulder is the triangle-shaped rock on the right side of the trail. Impossible to miss.

content.description: Nice and easy short problem named for the bee's nest I stumbled upon at the base. Start is at the bottom left slopey jug and work your way up and to the right; top-out recommended. (I definitely am not the FA, just thought I'd name and grade it for MP)
content.location: Park in the small lot on the left side of Hopewell Woods Road and follow the trail up the hill maybe 200 yards, the boulder on the right. Very easily spotted.

content.description: Start on the block shaped hold with on a jugy sloper pull into the crack and jam your way to a mossy jug that's sometimes wet. then move right into the angular holds. you can finish here or top out on the easy slab.
content.protection: I did it with nothing but I recommend pads and even a TR as there's trees on the top that could be ancor points.
content.location: strait up the main face.on the farthest right of the overhang.

content.description:
Huntington's formal description, life-like sculptures of bears and wolves welcome your arrival to this peaceful and tranquil setting featuring open fields and dense woodlands, fails to mention the bouldering and small cliff on the SE side of the park. The park was donated to the citizens of Connecticut by the internationally renowned Huntington family.  

  Along Hopewell Woods Rd is some parking (on left @ gate heading NE) and a few small outcropings and some bouldering. I'm not familiar with the lines here but I know others have climbed there. Def some more developing to be done...
